metadata.Description: The use of electric vehicles and other forms of electric transportation to reduce reliance on fossil fuels.

level 1.Description: Electric mobility addresses the issue of urban air pollution by promoting the use of electric vehicles that produce zero tailpipe emissions.
Electric mobility employs renewable energy sources such as solar and wind power for charging electric vehicles, reducing reliance on fossil fuels.
Electric mobility collaborates with automobile manufacturers to develop and produce electric vehicles with advanced technologies and improved performance.
Electric mobility supports the development and expansion of charging infrastructure to facilitate the widespread adoption of electric vehicles.
Electric mobility administers government incentives such as tax credits and subsidies to promote the purchase and use of electric vehicles.
Electric mobility measures the reduction in carbon emissions achieved through the adoption of electric vehicles as compared to conventional gasoline-powered vehicles.
Electric mobility aligns with climate change mitigation efforts by reducing greenhouse gas emissions and promoting sustainable transportation solutions.
Electric mobility is an instance of the clean energy transition, contributing to the shift towards cleaner and more sustainable energy sources in the transportation sector.

subelement_relations.Description: Electric vehicles are a key sub-element of electric mobility. They are vehicles that are powered by electricity instead of fossil fuels. Electric vehicles offer a sustainable and low-emission alternative to traditional vehicles, reducing greenhouse gas emissions and air pollution.

Charging infrastructure is an essential sub-element of electric mobility. It refers to the network of charging stations and infrastructure required to charge electric vehicles. The availability and accessibility of charging infrastructure are crucial for the widespread adoption of electric vehicles.

Battery technology is a critical sub-element of electric mobility. It involves the development and improvement of batteries used in electric vehicles. Advances in battery technology are essential for increasing the range, efficiency, and affordability of electric vehicles.

Smart grid integration is an important sub-element of electric mobility. It involves the integration of electric vehicles with the electrical grid to optimize charging, manage energy demand, and enable vehicle-to-grid interactions. Smart grid integration plays a key role in balancing energy supply and demand in a sustainable manner.

Policy and regulations are crucial sub-elements of electric mobility. They encompass government policies, incentives, and regulations that promote the adoption and deployment of electric vehicles. Effective policies and regulations can create a supportive environment for electric mobility and drive its growth.
